description:
First time to leave a review in 'Ubuntu Software'

Sengi is great and have been using it from a browser on and off for a good while!
summary: Excited to start using Sengi from Ubuntu!

description: The only thing this little fella needs to be perfect is a systemtray icon and the ability to auto start XD and a few tweaks for example be able to resize a panel and dynamic resizing when having multiple panels, but overall is almos perfect XD I only write reviews on software that I really like or that I really really hate XD

I really am pleasantly surprised by how great Sengi was. The design is a lot sleeker than the likes of Tootle, and it does a solid job of removing a lot of the bloat in the design which comes from using Mastodon on a web browser. Really glad I gave this application a chance.
summary: An intuitive and beautiful Mastodon client

description: just make a program without signalling your goodspeak

The interface is way too small and cannot be adjusted.
Pass.
Not bad, but missing some fonts under Axyl Linux
summary: Not bad, but missing some fonts under Axyl Linux

description: Row widths are fixed, makes reading one or two feeds impossible. Ridiculous that it can't be sized.
I love that is's easy to add my instance, and then quickly open multiple columns in the order i want them. Also can tell it to only show notifications for mentions, which is great.

I miss font resizing. The text is difficult to read on a small 4K screen. I have not found a way to resize it and it doesn't follow the system wide resize I've enabled. Other wise the app does it job.

L'interface est joli.
Possibilité d'inscrire plusieurs comptes.
Mais les messages n'apparaissent pas comme on peut le voir sur la copie d'écran présentée.
A moins que le problème ne soit présent que chez moi ?
summary: Je ne vois pas les messages
